comment_regular_data.body:
It has the redraw problem like this.

![スクリーンショット_2022-10-08_15-27-16](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41495/194692862-de33d032-6b84-48a1-a9c8-e91b26921153.png)
I have added the ugly hack for redraw.

There is `msg_ruler`:
```
["msg_ruler", content] ~
	Used to display 'ruler' when there is no space for the ruler in a
	statusline. `content` has the same format as in "msg_show". This event is
	sent with empty `content` to hide the last message.
```
Yes, noice.nvim ignores the event though.

> need to find an approach other than UPD_CLEAR. Also, can plugins handle this via vim.ui_attach meanwhile?

Fixed.

Note that we now also have [`'showcmdloc'`](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/21202).
Perhaps we don't need this anymore for `'showcmd'` but otherwise I think it should be added as an option to `'showcmdloc'` or be covered by `'showcmdloc' == "last"` if `'cmdheight' == 0`.
showcmd doesn't even work after the rebase
